pros: The salary is good for some positions, benefits are fair to good depending on which part of the world you work. Overall the job benefits the greater good of society - in that a quality education for K-12 kids is a laudable goal. Severance packages are reasonable.
cons: Perhaps a victim of its own success, the organization has grown at a very fast pace and seems unable to cope with the growth.  Re-structuring the organization into a business-driven (top down style of leadership) has led to centralizing services into three main hubs. This resulted in a mass exodus of staff who were the backbone of IBO's knowledge base.  Overall the changes have had a financial cost as well as an intellectual cost.  Will it be worth it?  Probably not.  Contracting out IT was a huge mistake, as many other non-profit organizations and businesses have already found out.
